content: @Alex Crichton Were there additional changes you wanted me to make to https://github.com/rust-lang/cargo/pull/9601? If not, I think it now addresses all your comments. There's also @cuviper's question about RUSTC_WORKSPACE_WRAPPER, which you may have a better take on than I do.
sorry I've been busy with other stuff this week, I will try to respond later today
Gentle nudge on this again — it should now reflect the latest requested changes.
Alex is on vacation, so it may be a while before he can get back to you.

Hey folks. Just wanted to follow up on https://github.com/rust-lang/cargo/pull/9601 — I'm leaving for vacation for a few weeks late tomorrow, so wanted to get a sense of whether I should remove the versioning envvar for now in the hopes of it landing while I'm away, or whether I should leave it as-is?

@Jon Gjengset please go ahead and drop the version environment variable, so that we can review the rest independently. That doesn't mean we're going to reject the version environment variable, but I think it's reasonably plausible we may want to consider it independently.
